DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term for a model that evaluates the mutation probability of breast cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Use of a conceptual model to evaluate the mutation probability of developing breast cancer. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit.  Breast carcinoma may affect both females and males.  It is the most common malignant tumor and the leading cause of carcinoma death in women.  Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation.  The widespread use of mammography has contributed in the detection of very early cancerous lesions (less than 2mm in diameter).  The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular).  Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route.  The most common site of lymph node involvment is the axilla.  Breast carcinomas infrequently occur in males (particularly elderly individuals and patients with Klinefelter's syndrome).  The therapy of breat carcinoma includes surgery, radiation therapy, hormonal therapy and chemotherapy, depending on the type and extend of the disease. --2002:Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.
Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.:1. A representation of something, often idealized or modified to make it conceptually easier to understand. 2. Something to be imitated. 3. In dentistry, a cast.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.
A representation of something, often idealized or modified to make it conceptually easier to understand.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Names of conceptual models used to evaluate the mutation probability of developing breast cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Claus model for calculating probability of developing breast cancer.
BRCAPRO model for calculating mutation probability of breast cancer.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A model designed to predict 10-year risk of breast cancer development, in a well-defined cohort of women with atypia.  The Tyrer-Cuzick model incorporates both genetic and nongenetic factors.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A model designed to predict 10-year risk of breast cancer development, in a well-defined cohort of women with atypia.  The Tyrer-Cuzick model incorporates both genetic and nongenetic factors.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A model designed to predict 10-year risk of breast cancer development, in a well-defined cohort of women with atypia.  The Tyrer-Cuzick model incorporates both genetic and nongenetic factors.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: (Breast and Ovarian Analysis of Disease Incidence and Carrier Estimation Algorithm, Antoniou et al., 2004, 2008) is a risk model for familial breast and ovarian cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: (Breast and Ovarian Analysis of Disease Incidence and Carrier Estimation Algorithm, Antoniou et al., 2004, 2008) is a risk model for familial breast and ovarian cancer.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (Breast and Ovarian Analysis of Disease Incidence and Carrier Estimation Algorithm, Antoniou et al., 2004, 2008) is a risk model for familial breast and ovarian cancer.
